name: Compelling Deterrence
text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. Then that player discards a card if you control a Zombie.

editions.flavor: "So much for neighborly hospitality!"
"So much for neighborly hospitality!"

name: Complete Disregard
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Exile target creature with power 3 or less.

editions.flavor: "We returned to the field and found poor Len, every detail of his final moment perfectly cast in that awful dust."—Javad Nasrin, outrider captain

name: Complex Automaton
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control seven or more permanents, return Complex Automaton to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"This wasteful design cannot possibly be Phyrexian."
—Belbe

name: Complicate
text:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
Cycling {2}{U} ({2}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Complicate, you may counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

name: Comply
text:
Aftermath (Cast this spell only from your graveyard. Then exile it.)
Choose a card name. Until your next turn, your opponents can't cast spells with the chosen name.

name: Composite Golem
text: Sacrifice Composite Golem: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: It binds the five suns in human form.
An artificer's experiment in cross-material engineering found its own purpose as an interpreter between cultures.

name: Compost
text: Whenever a black card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor:
A fruit must rot before its seed can sprout.
—Yavimaya saying

name: Compulsion
text:
{1}{U}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
{1}{U}, Sacrifice Compulsion: Draw a card.

text: Target player draws three cards. Then that player discards two cards unless he or she discards a land card.

editions.flavor: "Four parts molten bronze, yes . . . one part frozen mercury, yes, yes . . . but then what?"
"Four parts molten bronze, yes . . . one part frozen mercury, yes, yes . . . but then what?"
"Four parts molten bronze, yes . . . one part frozen mercury, yes, yes . . . but then what?"

text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
Enchanted creature has "{2}, Sacrifice this creature: You gain 2 life."

editions.flavor: The pain of death is nothing compared to the pain of failure.

text:
Concealed Courtyard enters the battlefield tapped unless you control two or fewer other lands.
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Where high society and dark opportunity intersect.

name: Concentrate
text: Draw three cards.

name: Concerted Effort
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, creatures you control gain flying until end of turn if a creature you control has flying. The same is true for fear, first strike, double strike, landwalk, protection, trample, and vigilance.

name: Conch Horn
text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Conch Horn: Draw two cards, then put a card from your hand on top of your library.

editions.flavor: Even the most skilled of modern mages only partially understand the Conch Horn's awesome powers.

name: Conclave Equenaut
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Flying

editions.flavor: Equenauts are the seeds of the Conclave, scattered on the four winds, searching for new places to take root.
Equenauts are the seeds of the Conclave, scattered on the four winds, searching for new places to take root.

name: Conclave Naturalists
text: When Conclave Naturalists enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.

editions.flavor: "Your swords and wards have no power here."
"Your swords and wards have no power here."

text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
When Conclave Phalanx enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each creature you control.

text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 for each other creature you control.

name: Concordant Crossroads
text: All creatures have haste.

name: Concordia Pegasus
text: Flying

editions.flavor:
"A kick from its hooves is like a bolt of lightning. I'd know. I've been hit by both."
—Rencz, Izzet chemister's aide

name: Concussive Bolt
text:
Concussive Bolt deals 4 damage to target player.
Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, creatures that player controls can't block this turn.

editions.flavor: Shock one, awe the rest.

name: Condemn
text: Put target attacking creature on the bottom of its owner's library. Its controller gains life equal to its toughness.

editions.flavor:
"No doubt the arbiters would put you away, after all the documents are signed. But I will have justice now."
—Alovnek, Boros guildmage

name: Condescend
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra

name: Conduit of Emrakul
text: Whenever Conduit of Emrakul attacks, add {C}{C} to your mana pool at the beginning of your next main phase this turn.

editions.flavor: As without, so within.

name: Conduit of Ruin
text:
When you cast Conduit of Ruin, you may search your library for a colorless creature card with converted mana cost 7 or greater, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
The first creature spell you cast each turn costs {2} less to cast.

name: Conduit of Storms
text:
Whenever Conduit of Storms attacks, add {R} to your mana pool at the beginning of your next main phase this turn.
{3}{R}{R}: Transform Conduit of Storms.

editions.flavor: It strikes with the fury of a tempest.

name: Cone of Flame
text: Cone of Flame deals 1 damage to target creature or player, 2 damage to another target creature or player, and 3 damage to a third target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"Mine is not the warmth of compassion."
—Ertai, wizard adept

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra

name: Confessor
text: Whenever a player discards a card, you may gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: "There will be gains for our losses. There will be rights for our wrongs."

name: Confirm Suspicions
text:
Counter target spell.
Investigate three times. (To investigate, create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")

editions.flavor: Everyone has something to hide.

name: Confiscate
text:
Enchant permanent (Target a permanent as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.)
You control enchanted permanent.

editions.flavor:
"I don't understand why he works so hard on a device to duplicate a sound so easily made with hand and armpit."
—Barrin, progress report

"The surface world contains nothing I cannot take."
—The Lord of Atlantis

"It is better to take what does not belong to you than to let it lie around neglected."
—Mark Twain, More Maxims of Mark

name: Confiscation Coup
text: Choose target artifact or creature. You get {E}{E}{E}{E} (four energy counters), then you may pay an amount of {E} equal to that permanent's converted mana cost. If you do, gain control of it.

editions.flavor: "Citizens, do not resist. This is for your safety. Tezzeret bids you to surrender your inventions. Now."

name: Conflagrate
text:
Conflagrate deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Flashback—{R}{R}, Discard X cards. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Conflux
text: Search your library for a white card, a blue card, a black card, a red card, and a green card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: After years of world-bending machinations, Bolas's triumph is at hand.

"It's self-indulgent, I admit, but I do like to watch my own symphony play itself out."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Confound
text:
Counter target spell that targets one or more creatures.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "Did I know Szat would betray us?" Urza asked quizzically. "I was counting on it."

name: Confront the Unknown
text: Investigate, then target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each Clue you control. (To investigate, create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")

editions.flavor:
"Never flinch from the truth."
—Thalia, Guardian of Thraben

name: Confusion in the Ranks
text: Whenever an artifact, creature, or enchantment enters the battlefield, its controller chooses target permanent another player controls that shares a card type with it. Exchange control of those permanents.

name: Congregate
text: Target player gains 2 life for each creature on the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"In the gathering there is strength for all who founder, renewal for all who languish, love for all who sing."
—Song of All, canto 642

—Song of All, canto 642

name: Congregation at Dawn
text: Search your library for up to three creature cards and reveal them. Shuffle your library, then put those cards on top of it in any order.

editions.flavor: "It is fitting that we meet in the first hour of light, for we are called by the Conclave to pierce a threat of darkness."

name: Conifer Strider
text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor: Atarka's presence thaws the glaciers of Qal Sisma, forcing its elementals to migrate or adapt.

name: Conjured Currency
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exchange control of Conjured Currency and target permanent you neither own nor control.

editions.flavor: A bargain in Keyhole Downs is always too good to be true.

name: Conjurer's Ban
text:
Name a card. Until your next turn, the named card can't be played.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Orzhov faithful file past to have their minds purged of "impure" desires. There, the guiltwardens eliminate any thoughts of hope or self-sufficiency.

name: Conjurer's Bauble
text: {T}, Sacrifice Conjurer's Bauble: Put up to one target card from your graveyard on the bottom of your library. Draw a card.

editions.flavor: It is the moment of discovery, the triumph of the mind, the reimagining of past glory.

name: Conjurer's Closet
text: At the beginning of your end step, you may exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

editions.flavor:
"Tomorrow wears yesterday's face."
—Kordel the Cryptic

"Tomorrow wears yesterday's face."
—Kordel the Cryptic

name: Conquer
text:
Enchant land
You control enchanted land.

editions.flavor:
"Why do we trade with those despicable elves? You don't live in forests, you burn them!"
—Avram Garrisson,

—Avram Garrisson,
Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

text:
Flying

Enchant creature

text:
Flying

editions.flavor: Blessed by the hands of Jin-Gitaxias.

"Dreams are fleeting. Reality even more so."
—Oona, queen of the fae

text:

Destroy any number of target artifacts and/or enchantments.

text:

Creature cards you own that aren't on the battlefield, creature spells you control, and creatures you control are the chosen type.

text:

Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

name: Constricting Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have "When this creature enters the battlefield, you may exile target creature an opponent controls until this creature leaves the battlefield."

editions.flavor: Slivers are often seen toying with enemies they capture, not out of cruelty, but to fully learn their physical capabilities.

name: Constricting Tendrils
text:
Target creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Priests of Bant protect their temples with traps more elaborate than any mosaic floor.

name: Consulate Crackdown
text: When Consulate Crackdown enters the battlefield, exile all artifacts your opponents control until Consulate Crackdown leaves the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"The workshops are silent. Our creations have been seized. They have killed what made us alive."
—Pia Nalaar

text: Crew 6 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 6 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

editions.flavor:
"It's like they planted another Bastion right in the middle of the harbor."
—Bes Tavani, Bomat merchant

Defender
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: All skyships entering or leaving the fairgrounds must pass through the security checkpoint.

text:

{T}: You get {E} (an energy counter).

editions.flavor:
"Our watchtowers are well positioned. Why don't we arm them?"
—Enforcer-Chief Ranaj

First strike
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
Whenever Consul's Lieutenant attacks, if it's renowned, other attacking creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Consul's Shieldguard
text:
When Consul's Shieldguard enters the battlefield, you get {E}{E} (two energy counters).
Whenever Consul's Shieldguard attacks, you may pay {E}. If you do, another target attacking creature gains indestructible until end of turn.

name: Consult the Necrosages
text:
Choose one —
• Target player draws two cards.
• Target player discards two cards.

editions.flavor: Dimir rank and file never see nor hear their guildmaster. All orders are given through mysterious necrosages who appear from the shadows, tersely toss out a command, and then melt into the darkness.

name: Consume Spirit
text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.

editions.flavor:
"Your blood, your marrow, your spirit—all are mine."
—Mayvar, minion of Geth

"You clerics brag about your strength of spirit, yet I take away the tiniest fragment, and you crumple like a rag doll."
—Sorin Markov

"Your blood, your marrow, your spirit—all are mine."
—Mayvar, minion of Geth
Mephidross changes all who dwell there, taking their lives and adding them to its own.

As Multani's troops invaded Urborg, the decay of the swamp became a feast for the living.

name: Consume the Meek

"Why does it destroy? It does, and to talk of reasons wastes time and breath."
—Nirthu, lone missionary

"Others ask why the Eldrazi destroy. I ask why they preserve."
—Ganda, Goma Fada deserter

text:
Consuming Aberration's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your opponents' graveyards.
Whenever you cast a spell, each opponent reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a land card, then puts those cards into his or her graveyard.

Enchant creature

text: {2}{B}{B}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Put a +1/+1 counter on Consumptive Goo.

editions.flavor: Silent as fog and relentless as plague, it is wet, creeping death.

text:

{4}, {T}: Proliferate, then proliferate again. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there. Then do it again.)

name: Contagious Nim
text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

editions.flavor:
"This species has grown to be my preferred receptacle for our divine message."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

Surge {U} (You may cast this spell for its surge cost if you or a teammate has cast another spell this turn.)
Enchant creature

text:
Flash
If a nontoken creature would enter the battlefield and it wasn't cast, exile it instead.

editions.flavor: Some protection requires a bit of finesse.

name: Contaminated Bond
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 3 life.

editions.flavor:
"My favorite curses are those that manifest slowly, blackening the soul in ways the victim cannot hope to understand."
—Erissa, bog witch
This leash disciplines the master.

name: Contaminated Ground
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a Swamp.

editions.flavor:
"No one cares about pollution until they can see it."
—Gurras, Golgari rot farmer

"The Na Plateau is lost. Do not ask what happened, and never return there."
—Nirthu, lone missionary

name: Contamination
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Contamination unless you sacrifice a creature.
If a land is tapped for mana, it produces {B} instead of any other type and amount.

name: Contemplation
text: Whenever you cast a spell, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"How fascinating it is to watch the machinations of one's own mind play themselves out."
—Volrath

name: Contempt
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature attacks, return it and Contempt to their owners' hands at end of combat.

editions.flavor:
"Predictable little man. In all these years you taught me so much yet learned so little."
—Volrath, to Starke

text:

editions.flavor:
"Improvisation is for those who failed to prepare."
—Jace Beleren

name: Contraband Kingpin
text:
Lifelink
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, scry 1.

editions.flavor: "Don't waste my time with trifles. Bring me works of art, and I will make you rich."

name: Contract from Below
text:
Remove Contract from Below from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
Discard your hand, ante the top card of your library, then draw seven cards.

name: Contradict
text:
Counter target spell.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Those who question Ojutai may not like the answers they receive.

name: Controlled Instincts
text:
Enchant red or green creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

editions.flavor: Togk Manytooth struggled helplessly as the kathari circled above him. For a warrior, immobilization is a fate worse than death.

name: Control Magic
text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

editions.flavor:
"Do as I think, not as I do."
—Jace Beleren
If you don't have the best toys, find the one who does.

"Do as I think, not as I do."
—Jace Beleren

"Do as I think, not as I do."
—Jace Beleren

name: Control of the Court
text: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.

editions.flavor: "Power-hungry eunuchs, the curse of the dynasty, have thrown the masses of the people into the depths of misery."

name: Controvert
text:
Counter target spell.
Recover {2}{U}{U} (When a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {2}{U}{U}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, exile this card.)

name: Conundrum Sphinx
text:
Flying
Whenever Conundrum Sphinx attacks, each player names a card. Then each player reveals the top card of his or her library. If the card a player revealed is the card he or she named, that player puts it into his or her hand. If it's not, that player puts it on the bottom of his or her library.

name: Convalescence
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 10 or less life, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: Selenia had hurt Mirri terribly, but injuries of the flesh could be treated. The wounds she had torn in Crovax's soul would never close.

name: Convalescent Care
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 5 or less life, you gain 3 life and draw a card.

editions.flavor: Enlightenment comes most swiftly at life's end.
